jsx.event
Class Handle

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      jsx.event.Handle

public final class Handle
extends Disposable

A class of browser event handles that handle browser events and their listening functions, eliminating browser dependencies.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org

Field Summary
static Var<JsFunction<java.lang.Void>> CANCELBUBBLE
          A global JavaScript function that creates browser event handlers that simply set JsEvent.cancelBubble of a browser event or the current event object for IE to true without doing anything else.
static Var<JsFunction<java.lang.Void>> FALSE
          A global JavaScript function that creates browser event handlers that simply return false without doing anything else.
static Var<JsFunction<JsObject>> HANDLER
          A global JavaScript function that creates browser event handlers.
static Var<JsFunction<JsObject>> IE
          An IE specific global JavaScript function that creates browser event handlers.
static Var<JsFunction<JsObject>> IEHOVER
          A IE specific global JavaScript function that creates mouse event handlers.

Field Detail

HANDLER

public static final Var<JsFunction<JsObject>> HANDLER

A global JavaScript function that creates browser event handlers.

This function returns an event handler function that handles browser events more efficiently, especially in JS Simulation mode, if invoked with the first argument being the browser event object to handle and the second argument being a function that performs an action.

Since:
1.0

IE

public static final Var<JsFunction<JsObject>> IE

An IE specific global JavaScript function that creates browser event handlers.

This function returns an event handler function that handles browser events more efficiently, especially in JS Simulation mode, if invoked with the argument being a function that performs an action with JsWindow.event as its argument.

Since:
1.0

FALSE

public static final Var<JsFunction<java.lang.Void>> FALSE

A global JavaScript function that creates browser event handlers that simply return false without doing anything else.

This function returns an event handler function that handles browser events more efficiently, especially in JS Simulation mode, if invoked with the argument being a browser event object.

Since:
1.0

CANCELBUBBLE

public static final Var<JsFunction<java.lang.Void>> CANCELBUBBLE

A global JavaScript function that creates browser event handlers that simply set JsEvent.cancelBubble of a browser event or the current event object for IE to true without doing anything else.

This function returns an event handler function that handles browser events more efficiently, especially in JS Simulation mode, if invoked with or without the argument being a browser event object.

Since:
1.0

IEHOVER

public static final Var<JsFunction<JsObject>> IEHOVER

A IE specific global JavaScript function that creates mouse event handlers.

This function returns an event handler function that handles mouse events more efficiently, especially in JS Simulation mode, if invoked with the first argument being a function that performs the action when a browser click event has happened on the source element and the second argument meaning whether to be checking a browser mouse out event.

Since:
1.0
Constructor Detail

Handle

public Handle(EventTarget et,
              java.lang.String eventtype,
              JsFunction<?> listener,
              boolean useCapture)

Constructs a browser-level event handle.

Parameters:
et - The browser event target.
eventtype - The browser event type.
listener - A browser event listening function.
useCapture - Specifies whether the listener is to be invoked only during the capturing phase of event propagation.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
EventTarget.addEventListener(String, JsFunction, Boolean), EventTarget.attachEvent(String, JsFunction), EventTarget.removeEventListener(String, JsFunction, Boolean), EventTarget.detachEvent(String, JsFunction)
Method Detail

attach

public final void attach()

Adds the browser event listener to the set of event handlers for the event target.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
EventTarget.addEventListener(String, JsFunction, Boolean), EventTarget.attachEvent(String, JsFunction), attach(Handle)

attach

public static final void attach(Handle h)

Attaches a handle if it exists.

Parameters:
h - The handle to manipulate.
Since:
1.0
See Also:

detach

public static final void detach(Handle h)

Detaches a handle if it exists.

Parameters:
h - The handle to manipulate.
Since:
1.0
See Also:

detach

public static final void detach(ObjectLike ini,
                                ArrayLike<Id<Handle>> hids)

Detaches handles in bulk.

Parameters:
ini - An object that keeps the handles.
hids - The ids of the handles.
Since:
1.0
See Also:
detach(), detach(Handle), EventTarget.removeEventListener(String, JsFunction, Boolean), EventTarget.detachEvent(String, JsFunction)

detach

public final void detach()

Removes the browser event listener from the set of event handlers for the event target.

Since:
1.0
See Also:
